Reordered header file in `test/integration/world_population.cc` in d6115b9  to allow it to run with all physics engines (was previously running with ode only). 

Probably need to ticket an issue about the fact that certain ordering of the header files disables running tests with different params

We are repeating this pattern of: 

* Check for the element
* Error and return false if not found
* Store the element if found

Sounds to me like we could try to unified a function for this at some point.

content.raw: The problem with this is that `InsertModelString` just creates a new `Factory` msg and queues it. So, it's an asynchronous way of creating a model and if I count models right after `InsertModelString`, they new model might not be loaded yet.
content.html: The problem with this is that InsertModelString just creates a new Factory msg and queues it. So, it's an asynchronous way of creating a model and if I count models right after InsertModelString, they new model might not be loaded yet.

content.raw: Update: All comments should be addressed and the code has been adapted to support @scpeters's suggestion for replacing the custom <region> block by a <pose> and a <box>/<cylinder>. As a bonus we can specify oriented boxes or cylinders using the orientation fields in <pose>.
content.html: Update: All comments should be addressed and the code has been adapted to support @scpeters's suggestion for replacing the custom <region> block by a <pose> and a <box>/<cylinder>. As a bonus we can specify oriented boxes or cylinders using the orientation fields in <pose>.

content.raw: Do we want to install the private header? Most of our private headers aren't installed (though it appears that `common/DemPrivate.hh` and `common/SphericalCoordinatesPrivate.hh` are installed, which could be changed).
content.html: Do we want to install the private header? Most of our private headers aren't installed (though it appears that common/DemPrivate.hh and common/SphericalCoordinatesPrivate.hh are installed, which could be changed).

content.raw:
`Population.hh` was originally including `PopulationPrivate.hh`, so I needed to install `PopulationPrivate.hh`. Otherwise, an external program (a plugin for example) that wants to include `Population.hh` would fail because one header would be missing.

If we remove the `#include PopulationPrivate.hh` from `Population.hh`, which I agree is the way to go we shouldn't need to install `PopulationPrivate.hh`.

Fixed in 84852d4
content.html:
Population.hh was originally including PopulationPrivate.hh, so I needed to install PopulationPrivate.hh. Otherwise, an external program (a plugin for example) that wants to include Population.hh would fail because one header would be missing.

If we remove the #include PopulationPrivate.hh from Population.hh, which I agree is the way to go we shouldn't need to install PopulationPrivate.hh.

Fixed in 84852d4

This is probably ok, but I think we don't usually call using namespace more than two times in a file. Usually:

using namespace gazebo;
using namespace physics;

since Population is in the physics class. This is just a comment, not a recommendation to change anything.

content.raw: I'd prefer to keep the `using namespace common` because there are quite a few calls to `GZ_ASSERT` unless it goes against our style.
content.html: I'd prefer to keep the using namespace common because there are quite a few calls to GZ_ASSERT unless it goes against our style.
